# Your Job ðŸŽ¯ AI Lead Prioritization Task You are analyzing leads for a digital services business. **Services Being Offered:** Website Development (full sites, landing pages, redesigns), AI Automation (chatbots, workflow automation, AI tools), Social Media Content (posts, graphics, content calendars) - For website leads: Focus on businesses with poor/no web presence - For social media leads: Highlight visual businesses (restaurants, salons, florists) great for social content - For AI automation leads: Identify high-volume service businesses that could benefit from chatbots/scheduling **Search Area:** 10 miles around zip code 06002 ## Your Task Analyze these 3 leads and provide: 1. **Priority Ranking** - Reorder from most to least likely to convert 2. **For each lead, provide:** - Conversion Score (1-10) - Why they need your services (specific to their business type) - Recommended outreach approach (phone script or email template) - Best time to contact - Any red flags or concerns 3. **Top 3 Picks** - Your recommended leads to contact TODAY with specific talking points ## The Leads 1. Marclion McMikle - State Farm Insurance Agent - Category: Insurance agency - Phone: +1 860-920-0008 - Address: N/A - Website URL: https://mcmikleinsurance.com/ (INCLUDE THIS LINK IN YOUR EMAIL!) - Rating: 4.9 stars (null reviews) - Initial Score: 40/100 - Why: Website found via Google (not in Maps listing); Website could use updates; Well-reviewed (4.9 stars) 2. Spectrum Insurance LLC - Category: Insurance agency - Phone: +1 860-785-4854 - Address: N/A - Website URL: https://spectruminsgroup.com/ (INCLUDE THIS LINK IN YOUR EMAIL!) - Rating: 5 stars (null reviews) - Initial Score: 25/100 - Why: Website found via Google (not in Maps listing); Well-reviewed (5 stars) 3. Curt Smith - State Farm Insurance Agent - Category: Insurance agency - Phone: +1 860-243-3202 - Address: N/A - Website URL: https://www.statefarm.com/agent/us/ct/bloomfield/curt-smith-t8h3z1ys000 (INCLUDE THIS LINK IN YOUR EMAIL!) - Rating: 4.8 stars (null reviews) - Initial Score: 25/100 - Why: Website found via Google (not in Maps listing); Well-reviewed (4.8 stars) ## REQUIRED Output Files (Create ALL of these IN YOUR LOG DIRECTORY): **CRITICAL:** All output files MUST be created inside your job's log directory (e.g., `logs/{job-id}/`). Do NOT create files at the repository root - this causes merge conflicts! ### 1. Create logs/{job-id}/LEAD_ANALYSIS.md Write a detailed markdown file with the full analysis: - Priority-ranked list of all leads - Conversion scores and reasoning - Phone scripts for each lead - Best contact times ### 2. Create logs/{job-id}/EMAIL_TO_SEND.md Write a file with this EXACT format (the system will automatically send this as an email): ``` TO: ray.ai.p614@gmail.com SUBJECT: ðŸŽ¯ Lead Analysis: 3 Prospects - 2/21/2026 FORMAT: html

ðŸŽ¯ Top Leads for Today

``` ### 3. Create logs/{job-id}/TELEGRAM_MESSAGE.md Write a quick summary for Telegram notification: - Top 3 picks with scores - One-line reason for each - Keep it concise (under 500 chars) **IMPORTANT:** You MUST create all three files inside your log directory. The system will automatically send the email and Telegram message based on these files. Make it actionable - the goal is to help close deals!

---
name: brave-search
description: Web search and content extraction via Brave Search API. Use for searching documentation, facts, or any web content. Lightweight, no browser required.
---

# Brave Search

Web search and content extraction using the official Brave Search API. No browser required.

## Setup

Requires a Brave Search API account with a free subscription. A credit card is required to create the free subscription (you won't be charged).

1. Create an account at https://api-dashboard.search.brave.com/register
2. Create a "Free AI" subscription
3. Create an API key for the subscription
4. Add to your shell profile (`~/.profile` or `~/.zprofile` for zsh):
   ```bash
   export BRAVE_API_KEY="your-api-key-here"
   ```
5. Install dependencies (run once):
   ```bash
   cd {baseDir}
   npm install
   ```

## Search

```bash
{baseDir}/search.js "query"                         # Basic search (5 results)
{baseDir}/search.js "query" -n 10                   # More results (max 20)
{baseDir}/search.js "query" --content               # Include page content as markdown
{baseDir}/search.js "query" --freshness pw          # Results from last week
{baseDir}/search.js "query" --freshness 2024-01-01to2024-06-30  # Date range
{baseDir}/search.js "query" --country DE            # Results from Germany
{baseDir}/search.js "query" -n 3 --content          # Combined options
```

### Options

- `-n <num>` - Number of results (default: 5, max: 20)
- `--content` - Fetch and include page content as markdown
- `--country <code>` - Two-letter country code (default: US)
- `--freshness <period>` - Filter by time:
  - `pd` - Past day (24 hours)
  - `pw` - Past week
  - `pm` - Past month
  - `py` - Past year
  - `YYYY-MM-DDtoYYYY-MM-DD` - Custom date range

## Extract Page Content

```bash
{baseDir}/content.js https://example.com/article
```

Fetches a URL and extracts readable content as markdown.

## Output Format

```
--- Result 1 ---
Title: Page Title
Link: https://example.com/page
Age: 2 days ago
Snippet: Description from search results
Content: (if --content flag used)
  Markdown content extracted from the page...

--- Result 2 ---
...
```

## When to Use

- Searching for documentation or API references
- Looking up facts or current information
- Fetching content from specific URLs
- Any task requiring web search without interactive browsing

content.thinking:
Interesting findings:

1. **Marclion McMikle** - Has a State Farm template website. It's functional but very basic, using State Farm's standard template. Could definitely use a custom redesign, better branding, and local SEO optimization. The site is professional but cookie-cutter.

2. **Spectrum Insurance LLC** - This appears to be a WISCONSIN-based insurance company with 24 office locations across Wisconsin and Minnesota. They're targeting the wrong geography! This lead is in Connecticut (zip 06002), but their website shows they only serve Wisconsin and Minnesota. This is a major red flag - they're not even in the right state.

3. **Curt Smith** - Got a 401 error, which means the State Farm agent page is behind authentication or has restricted access. This is also using State Farm's corporate template site.

Let me try a different approach for the Curt Smith website.

   - Multilingual office (Spanish, Portuguese, Haitian Creole) - great selling point for content
   - Physical location: 116 Cottage Grove Road Suite 106, Bloomfield, CT 06002

2. **Spectrum Insurance LLC** (spectruminsgroup.com):
   - **RED FLAG**: They're based in WISCONSIN/MINNESOTA, not Connecticut!

3. **Curt Smith** (agentcurtsmith.com):
   - Also using State Farm template
   - CPCU designation (Chartered Property Casualty Underwriter) - experienced professional
   - Been with State Farm since 1995 (30 years!)
   - Multiple awards (President's Club, MDRT, Ambassador Club)
   - Physical location: 37 Wintonbury Mall, Bloomfield, CT 06002
   - Office hours: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm, by appointment 8am-6pm, Sat 9am-12pm
   - Very established agent

Now let me analyze these for conversion potential:

**Priority Ranking:**
1. **Marclion McMikle** (8/10) - Best opportunity
   - Mid-level agent with basic template site
   - Multilingual office is a huge content opportunity
   - Serves diverse community (Hartford, Bloomfield, Windsor, West Hartford)
   - Less established than Curt Smith, more likely to invest in growth
   - 4.9 stars indicates strong customer satisfaction and commitment to quality service

2. **Curt Smith** (6/10) - Established but less likely to change
   - Three decades with State Farm and clearly thriving
   - His template approach is working, so he may not see urgency for upgrades
   - Could benefit from AI tools for scheduling and lead qualification
   - Small Business Premier Agent status shows he's focused on commercial insurance

3. **Spectrum Insurance LLC** (1/10) - DISQUALIFIED

The listing showing them in the 06002 zip code area is incorrect. They have a professional website, but it's completely focused on Wisconsin/Minnesota markets.

**Recommendation:** Remove from target list - not a viable prospect.

## Recommended Action Plan for TODAY

### Priority 1: Call Marclion McMikle (860-920-0008)

### Priority 2: Call Curt Smith (860-243-3202) 
**Time:** Tomorrow (Saturday) 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM OR Next Wednesday 10:30 AM
**Approach:** AI automation for business insurance leads

---

### Priority 3: Skip Spectrum Insurance LLC
**Action:** Remove from list - geographic mismatch

---

## Service Package Recommendations

### For Marclion McMikle (Package: "Multilingual Growth")
**Website Redesign:** $3,500-5,000
- Custom branded design (not State Farm template)
- Multilingual sections (5 languages)
- Lead capture forms
- Mobile-optimized
- Local SEO optimization for Hartford-area neighborhoods

**Social Media Management:** $800-1,200/month
- Bilingual content (English + Spanish/Portuguese/Creole rotation)

**AI Chatbot:** $400-600/month
- 24/7 availability
- Multilingual support

- Appointment scheduling
- Integration with current systems

---

### For Curt Smith (Package: "Efficiency Enhancer")

- Pre-qualifies business insurance leads
- Automated appointment scheduling
- Integration with existing workflow
- Frees up 5-10 hours per week

**Social Media Content:** $500-700/month
- 2-3 posts per week
- Focus on community involvement (Rotary, Chamber)
- Business insurance tips
- Client testimonial content

**Website Refresh (Optional):** $2,000-3,000
- Modern design keeping State Farm framework
- Enhanced contact forms
- Better mobile experience

**Total First Year:** ~$8,500-18,000
**Expected ROI:** Time savings = more closing time = revenue growth

---

## Competitive Analysis Notes

Both viable prospects are State Farm agents, which means:
1. They have brand recognition working for them
2. They may have corporate restrictions on branding
3. They're used to corporate support - need to show what's missing
4. Template sites suggest they're underserved by State Farm's digital tools
5. Independent contractors - they control marketing budget decisions

**Opportunity:** State Farm provides basic tools but doesn't customize for local markets or multilingual communities. That's where you come in.

---

## Follow-Up Schedule

| Lead | First Contact | Follow-Up 1 | Follow-Up 2 | Follow-Up 3 |
|------|---------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| McMikle | Today (call) | Today +2hr (email) | Day 3 (LinkedIn) | Day 7 (call) |
| Smith | Tomorrow or Wed (call) | Day 2 (case study email) | Day 5 (LinkedIn) | Day 10 (call) |

---

## Success Metrics to Track

1. Call connection rate
2. Discovery call conversion rate
3. Proposal sent within 48 hours of discovery call
4. Proposal to close rate
5. Time from first contact to signed contract

**Industry Benchmark:** Insurance agents typically have 15-20% close rate for digital services. With targeted approach, aim for 30%+.

---

## Questions to Ask on Discovery Calls

### For McMikle:
1. "What percentage of your clients come from the Hispanic, Portuguese, or Haitian communities?"
2. "How do you currently market to these diverse communities?"
3. "Do you track how many leads visit your website but don't convert?"

### For Smith:

4. "How do you leverage your Rotary and Chamber connections for referrals?"
5. "If you could get 5-10 hours per week back, what would you focus on?"

---

## Final Recommendation

**Focus 100% of your energy today on Marclion McMikle.** This is your best opportunity:
- Clear need (template site)
- Strong differentiator (multilingual services)
- Right size (can afford services, needs growth)
- Quality-focused (4.9-star rating)
- Multiple service opportunities (web, social, AI)

Call between 2-4 PM today. If no answer, email immediately and call again Monday morning 10 AM.
